metadata.title: CVE-2023-32233 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel through 6.3.1, a use-after-free in Netfilter nf_tableswhen processing batch requests can be abused to perform arbitrary read andwrite operations on kernel memory. Unprivileged local users can obtain rootprivileges. This occurs because anonymous sets are mishandled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic-lpae - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic-64k - 6.3.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-aws - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-azure - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-gcp - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-ibm - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-lowlatency - 6.3.0-7.7.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-lowlatency-64k - 6.3.0-7.7.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-oracle - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-raspi - 6.5.0-1002.2
No subscription required
